description.summary: CLM-specific directory in the data archive file for CLM type input forcing data. Must be a relative path.
Starting year to loop data over. Example: If the input data spans 1900-2010, set = 2000 to tell the model to use the input data from 2000 onwards.
Year align

Ending year to loop data over. For example: If the input data spans 1900-2010, set this to 2005 to tell the model to use the input data up to 2005. If you run a longer simulation than the span between YR_START and YR_END, the input will be looped.
Run start date (yyyy-mm-dd); normally at the start of the same year as YR_START. Only used for startup or hybrid run types.
Sets the run length together with STOP_OPTION; Number of STOP_OPTION to simulate. E.g. STOP_N=5 and STOP_OPTION=ndays sets a simulation period of 5 days.
Sets the run length together with STOP_N; Time span of simulation (years, months, days, seconds, or model timesteps). E.g. STOP_N=5 and STOP_OPTION=ndays sets a simulation period of 5 days.
Alternative date yyyymmdd date option; sets the run length with STOP_OPTION and STOP_N. Negative value implies that this alternative is not used.

Startup or Restart. Startup: a 'cold' start from bare ground. The vegetation and climate is not in equilibrium and the model may not produce realistic output. No spin-up files used. Use this mode for quick testing, or for making your own spin-up. Restart: continues running an existing case after it has been stopped.” (Without restart files, the RUN_TYPE should not include “branch” etc., but should be replaced with options to manipulate spin-up behavior (simplified C soil pool initialization, etc.)
Tuning parameters and initial conditions for a CLM model version and meteorological forcing combination.
CO2 concentration to use when co2_type is constant.
Path to an alternative netcdf fates parameter file.
Full pathname of surface data file.
If or how to use advanced fire behaviour with SPITFIRE module.
description.details:
0 : Simulations of fire are off
1 : use a global constant lightning rate found in fates_params.
2 : use an external lightning dataset.
3 : use an external confirmed ignitions dataset (not available through standard CSEM dataset collection).
4 : use external lightning and population datasets to simulate both natural and anthropogenic
ignitions.

choices.label: Use a global constant lightning rate
Use an external confirmed ignitions dataset
Use external lightning and population datasets

description.summary: Use variable soil depth from depth to bedrock data set.
description.details: If present on surface dataset, use depth to bedrock information to specify spatially variable soil thickness. If not present, use bottom of soil column (nlevsoi).

description.summary: Fields to add to history tape series 1.
description.details: You can add any variable from the list in the link, if it is not already in the options. Just type tha variable name and press enter. Note that the entered variable name must exactly match the name in the list.

description.summary: Fields to add to history tape series 2.
description.details: You can add any variable from the list in the link, if it is not already in the options. Just type tha variable name and press enter. Note that the entered variable name must exactly match the name in the list.

description.summary: Fields to add to history tape series 2.
description.details: You can add any variable from the list in the link, if it is not already in the options. Just type tha variable name and press enter. Note that the entered variable name must exactly match the name in the list.

description.summary: Fields to add to history tape series 2.
description.details: You can add any variable from the list in the link, if it is not already in the options. Just type tha variable name and press enter. Note that the entered variable name must exactly match the name in the list.

description.summary: Fields to add to history tape series 2.
description.details: You can add any variable from the list in the link, if it is not already in the options. Just type tha variable name and press enter. Note that the entered variable name must exactly match the name in the list.

description.summary: Fields to add to history tape series 2.
description.details: You can add any variable from the list in the link, if it is not already in the options. Just type tha variable name and press enter. Note that the entered variable name must exactly match the name in the list.

description.summary: Transform clm original output to long lat grid (output originally made for a string of gridcells).
description.details: Some PFT information only available in this 1D string by setting this to false

description.summary: Per file averaging flag.
description.details:
'A' (average over history period)
'I' (instantaneous)
'X' (maximum over history period)
'M' (minimum over history period)

description.summary: Per tape series history write frequency.
description.details:
positive means in time steps
0=monthly
negative means hours
(i.e. 5 means every 24 time-steps and -24 means every day)

description.summary: Per tape series maximum number of time samples.
Number of FATES PFT dimensions in the fates_paramfile.
List of PFT indices to include in the simulation.
Real number; Carbon to biomass multiplier of bulk structural tissues, used in allometry to calculate biomass of several tissues.
description.details: For instance, it is used to calculate plant leaf biomass blmax = (p1*min(d,dbh_maxh)**p2)/c2b where p1 is the slope, d is plant diameter, dbh_maxh is stem diameter at breast height at plant max height, and p2 is the exponent.

description.summary: Growth respiration factor.
description.details: a fixed fraction of the carbon remaining after maintenance respiration has occurred.

description.summary: Leaf longevity (ie turnover timescale), in years
Specific Leaf Area (SLA) at top of canopy, projected area basis, in m^2/gC
Maximum carboxylation rate of Rub. at 25C, canopy top, in umol CO2/m^2/s
Leaf/stem orientation index, important for the absorption, transmittance and reflectance of solar radiation
description.details: Direct radiation is extinguished through the canopy according to a coefficient calculated from the incoming solar angle and the leaf angle distribution parameter.

description.summary: background mortality rate, per year
description.details: Together with other sources of mortality (fire, hydraulic failure, etc.), background mortality is a ‘rest’ category that ensures the overall mortality rates are reasonable.

description.summary: Minimum temperature tolerance, in degrees C
Soil moisture (btran units) at which drought mortality begins for non-hydraulic model
Binary flag for evergreen leaf habit (0 or 1).
Binary flag for cold seasonal-deciduous leaf habit (0 or 1)
description.details: Whether (1) or not (0) the PFT drops its leaves in autumn when it gets colder, and regains them in spring based on temperature thresholds. PFTs can also be drought-deciduous, set by the fates_phen_stress_decid parametr..

description.summary: root longevity (alternatively, turnover time), in years
description.details: Roots that die, become litter that can decompose in the soil.

description.summary: Binary woody lifeform flag (0 or 1). Tree and shrub PFTs have woody tissues, while grass PFT lack wood.
